words.definition: feeling or showing joy and pleasure
words.example_sentence: I felt _____ when I got a new toy.

words.definition: showing courage and not being afraid
words.example_sentence: The _____ firefighter saved the cat from the tree.

words.definition: being friendly, helpful, and caring toward others
words.example_sentence: My teacher is very _____ and helps everyone.

words.definition: able to learn and understand things quickly
words.example_sentence: The _____ student answered all the questions correctly.

words.definition: having great power or physical strength
words.example_sentence: The _____ athlete lifted the heavy weights.

words.definition: making little or no noise; peaceful
words.example_sentence: The library was very _____ so people could read.

words.definition: moving or happening quickly
words.example_sentence: The _____ runner won the race.

words.definition: large in size; large
words.example_sentence: The elephant was very _____ compared to the mouse.

words.definition: giving off a lot of light; very colorful
words.example_sentence: The _____ sun made everything warm and cheerful.

words.definition: free from dirt or mess; neat and tidy
words.example_sentence: I helped my mom keep the room _____.

words.definition: causing laughter; amusing
words.example_sentence: The _____ joke made everyone laugh.

words.definition: kind, mild, and soft in manner
words.example_sentence: The _____ breeze felt nice on my face.

words.definition: telling the truth; not lying
words.example_sentence: It's important to be _____ with your friends.

words.definition: making a lot of noise; not quiet
words.example_sentence: The _____ music could be heard from far away.

words.definition: tidy and organized; clean
words.example_sentence: My desk is always _____ so I can find my things.

words.definition: feeling pleased about something you did
words.example_sentence: I felt _____ when I finished my project.

words.definition: playful and funny; not serious
words.example_sentence: We made _____ faces in the mirror.

words.definition: having an even surface without bumps
words.example_sentence: The _____ ice was perfect for skating.

words.definition: having great height; not short
words.example_sentence: The _____ tree reached up to the sky.

words.definition: having a comfortable temperature; not hot or cold
words.example_sentence: The _____ blanket kept me comfortable at night.

words.definition: peaceful and relaxed; not excited or worried
words.example_sentence: The _____ lake was perfect for fishing.

words.definition: paying attention to avoid mistakes or danger
words.example_sentence: Be _____ when crossing the street.

words.definition: wanting to know or learn about something
words.example_sentence: The _____ cat explored every corner of the house.

words.definition: very excited and wanting to do something
words.example_sentence: I was _____ to start my first day of school.

words.definition: kind and pleasant to others
words.example_sentence: The _____ dog wagged its tail at everyone.

words.definition: willing to give or share with others
words.example_sentence: My _____ friend shared her snacks with everyone.

words.definition: willing to help others; useful
words.example_sentence: The _____ student helped clean up the classroom.

words.definition: faithful and true to friends or family
words.example_sentence: A _____ friend always stands by your side.

words.definition: able to wait calmly without getting upset
words.example_sentence: Be _____ and wait your turn in line.

words.definition: showing good manners and respect
words.example_sentence: It's important to be _____ when speaking to adults.

words.definition: able to make or think of new things
words.example_sentence: The _____ artist painted beautiful pictures.

words.definition: full of energy and active
words.example_sentence: The _____ puppy ran around the yard all day.

words.definition: very strong and aggressive
words.example_sentence: The _____ lion protected its cubs.

words.definition: moving in a smooth and elegant way
words.example_sentence: The _____ dancer moved across the stage.

words.definition: strange and hard to understand
words.example_sentence: The _____ footprints led into the dark forest.

words.definition: calm and quiet; without trouble
words.example_sentence: The _____ garden was a nice place to relax.

words.definition: having great strength or force
words.example_sentence: The _____ engine could pull heavy loads.

words.definition: moving or happening fast
words.example_sentence: The _____ rabbit ran across the field.

words.definition: not smooth; having bumps or uneven surface
words.example_sentence: The _____ road made the car bounce.

words.definition: nervous or uncomfortable around other people
words.example_sentence: The _____ child hid behind her mother.

words.definition: honest and meaning what you say
words.example_sentence: Her _____ apology showed she really meant it.

words.definition: strong and well-built; not easily broken
words.example_sentence: The _____ table could hold many heavy books.

words.definition: thinking about others and being considerate
words.example_sentence: It was _____ of you to help me with my homework.

words.definition: having good judgment and knowledge
words.example_sentence: The _____ owl gave good advice to the young bird.

words.definition: moving around a lot; full of energy
words.example_sentence: The _____ children played outside all afternoon.

words.definition: very pretty or pleasing to look at
words.example_sentence: The _____ sunset painted the sky in orange and pink.

words.definition: quick to understand and learn; smart
words.example_sentence: The _____ fox found a way to reach the grapes.

words.definition: feeling sure about yourself and your abilities
words.example_sentence: The _____ student raised her hand to answer.

words.definition: brave and not afraid to face danger
words.example_sentence: The _____ knight faced the dragon without fear.

words.definition: easily broken or damaged; fragile
words.example_sentence: Handle the _____ butterfly wings with care.

words.definition: feeling very happy and enthusiastic about something
words.example_sentence: I was so _____ about going to the amusement park.

words.definition: easily broken or damaged; delicate
words.example_sentence: The _____ glass ornament needed careful handling.

words.definition: feeling thankful and appreciative
words.example_sentence: I was _____ for my friend's help with my homework.

words.definition: not thinking you are better than others; modest
words.example_sentence: Despite winning, the athlete remained _____.

words.definition: feeling worried or anxious about something
words.example_sentence: I felt _____ before my first piano recital.

words.definition: doing what you are told; following rules
words.example_sentence: The _____ dog sat when its owner commanded.

words.definition: very valuable and important; treasured
words.example_sentence: The family photo was _____ to me.

words.definition: able to be trusted and depended on
words.example_sentence: My _____ friend always keeps her promises.

words.definition: able to be trusted to do what is right
words.example_sentence: The _____ student always finished homework on time.

words.definition: having a natural ability to do something well
words.example_sentence: The _____ musician played the piano beautifully.

words.definition: able to be trusted and relied upon
words.example_sentence: A _____ friend never breaks promises.

words.definition: being the only one of its kind; special
words.example_sentence: Each person has a _____ fingerprint.
